instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No chime or display
threads.message:
This board like 3 years ago I send it to repair to a ebay guy , he send it back working and die again , I send it back , he send it back working and die again , I send it back , he send it back working and die again , my warranty on this board expires , and I have to buy anotherboard for my customer back then.

I save it , and now recently I start troubleshooting this board I order a donorboard and all that shit , and when I when to the power rails I find out that PP1V2R1V05_S5  was not there I replace <CHIP>U7750</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> and I got back that rail to work

After that machine power on, fan spin, but I cant hear any chime and I have no display  I did the microscope light trick behind the apple logo to check for display and nothing.

I when and check the next rails: [FONT=Courier][SIZE=1][FONT=Courier][SIZE=1][SIZE=12px]<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>  That read around .9v almost 1v


=<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_MCP</SIGNAL>= 1v

I did check some other rails but i want to hear what the people who knows more than me think i should be checking on this one. thank you![/SIZE][/SIZE][/FONT][/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No chime or display
threads.message: Original problem was probably just <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>. Ebay idiot reflowed the MCP and messed it up. Replace MCP, but this is soooo old.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No chime or display
threads.message: thank you for your answer , i have no equipment or skills to replace a MCP yet i guess i will just send the board back where it was saved , and yes i work on many olderboards i figure that will be cheaper to learn with older boards than with new ones.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No chime or display
threads.message:
duke's psychic powers are correct here.

replacing an MCP79 is easy as cake. Finding one that isn't dead.. good luck with that one.
